definitions.definition: the killing of a large number of people especially in a cruel way

examples.text: the bloody massacre of innocent civilians
He accused the troops of the indiscriminate massacre of civilians.
The massacre was carried out by enemy troops.

definitions.definition: a very big defeat in a game or competition

examples.text: The game was a 10–0 massacre for our team.

wordOrigin: late 16th cent.: from French, of unknown origin.
